content.text:
Build a full iOS app called The Poker Place. The app is a private poker community where users can request access, log in, and RSVP to tournaments. Include both front-end screens and backend admin screens.

App Requirements:

USER ROLES

Regular users: can register, wait for approval, log in, view tournaments, see details, RSVP.

Admin users: can approve accounts, create tournaments, edit tournaments, view RSVP lists.

DATABASE STRUCTURE
Collection: Users

full_name (text)

email (text)

phone (text)

nickname (text)

password (secure)

status (options: pending, approved, rejected, admin)

Collection: Tournaments

name (text)

date_time (datetime)

location (text)

buy_in (text)

blind_structure (long text)

max_players (number)

created_by (user reference)

Collection: RSVPs

user (reference)

tournament (reference)

timestamp (datetime)

FRONT-END SCREENS
1. Welcome Screen

App logo + title “The Poker Place”

Buttons:

Login

Request Access

Footer: “Private poker community — access by approval only”

2. Login Screen

Components:

Email input

Password input

Login button

“Forgot password?” link

Logic:

Only users with status = approved can log in

If status = pending → show error: “Your account is pending approval.”

If invalid credentials → show error

3. Request Access Screen

Components:

Full Name input

Email input

Phone Number input

Preferred Nickname input

Submit button

Logic:

Create new user with status = pending

Confirmation message: “Your registration request has been submitted. You will be notified once approved.”

4. Home Screen (Upcoming Tournaments)

Components:

List of tournaments sorted by date

Each list item shows:

Name

Date & time

Location

Buy-in

RSVP button (if logged in and approved)

Logic:

Only show RSVP button if user is approved

If RSVP exists → show “✔ RSVP’d” instead

5. Tournament Details Screen

Components:

Tournament Name

Date / Time

Buy-in amount

Blind structure (text block or table)

Max players

List of users RSVP’d

RSVP button / Cancel RSVP button

Logic:

Tapping RSVP creates an RSVP record

Tapping cancel deletes the RSVP record

6. My Tournaments Screen

Components:

List of RSVPs where user = current user

Show upcoming RSVPs

Optional: past tournaments

7. Profile Screen

Components:

Full name

Nickname

Email (readonly)

Edit nickname button

Logout button

ADMIN SCREENS (Backend)
Admin Screen: User Approvals

Components:

Table of users with filters: pending, approved, rejected

Approve button

Reject button

Logic:

Approve: set status = approved

Reject: set status = rejected

Admin Screen: Tournament Management

Components:

Button: Create Tournament

Tournament list (editable)

Fields for New Tournament:

Tournament Name

Date/Time

Location

Buy-in

Blind structure

Max players

Logic:

Save record to Tournaments

Show only to admin users

Admin Screen: RSVP Viewer

Components:

Dropdown: Select Tournament

Table: User full name, nickname, phone

Logic:

List RSVPs where tournament = selected

Here's the plan for building "The Poker Place" app:

**Features for the First Version:**

*   **Welcome/Login/Request Access Flow:** Implement the Welcome, Login, and Request Access screens with basic UI elements and navigation. The "Request Access" functionality will simulate submitting a request. The login will use hardcoded credentials for a default approved user and an admin user. Error messages will be displayed as specified.
*   **Home Screen (Upcoming Tournaments):** Create the Home screen with a list of upcoming tournaments. Tournament data will be hardcoded for now. Implement the RSVP button with a simple toggle to simulate RSVPing.
*   **Tournament Details Screen:** Develop the Tournament Details screen to display detailed information about a selected tournament. The RSVP button will toggle the RSVP status.
*   **Profile Screen:** Implement the Profile screen with user details (hardcoded for now) and a Logout button.

**Design Elements:**

*   **Colors:**
    *   Background: `#f5f5f5` (Light gray)
    *   Text: `#333333` (Dark gray)
    *   TextSecondary: `#777777` (Medium gray)
    *   Primary: `#2196F3` (Blue)
    *   Secondary: `#E91E63` (Pink)
    *   Accent: `#FFC107` (Amber)
    *   Card: `#FFFFFF` (White)
    *   Highlight: `#BBDEFB` (Light blue)
*   **Typography:** Use the default system font for a clean and modern look.

**Implementation Plan:**

1.  **Create new screens:** Create new files for each of the screens mentioned above (Welcome, Login, Request Access, Home, Tournament Details, Profile).
2.  **Implement UI:** Add the UI elements (buttons, inputs, lists, etc.) to each screen based on your specifications. Use placeholder data for the tournament list and user details.
3.  **Implement Navigation:** Set up navigation between the screens using React Navigation.
4.  **Implement Basic Logic:** Add basic logic for the RSVP button (toggle state), login (hardcoded credentials), and request access (display confirmation message).
5.  **Implement Styling:** Apply the specified colors and typography to the UI elements.

6. **My Tournaments Screen** - View all tournaments you've RSVP'd to
7. **Profile Screen** - View and edit personal information, manage nickname

### **Admin Features:**

10. **Tournament Management** - Create, edit, and delete tournaments
11. **Create Tournament** - Full form with date/time picker for new tournaments
12. **Edit Tournament** - Modify existing tournament details
13. **RSVP Viewer** - View all RSVPs for any tournament with user contact info

### **Technical Implementation:**

- **Authentication System** - Context-based auth with AsyncStorage persistence
- **Data Management** - Local storage with Users, Tournaments, and RSVPs collections
- **Navigation** - Expo Router with modal presentations for admin screens
- **UI/UX** - Clean, modern design with the specified color scheme
- **Platform Support** - Both iOS (with native tabs) and Android/Web (with floating tab bar)
